sections.title: Networking Components
items: This page demonstrates networking components that can be used to access remote data in a consistent way.

sections.title: Remote Data Source
items: The remote data source component is a clever width that loads data from an remote API URL; and allows it to be quickly rendered inside a Vue component.

sections.title: Normal Behaviour
items: When the component is able to load data, by default, it will render out information about the request, and the response object in a code block.

sections.title: Network Error
items: By default, the VuesiteRemoteDataSource component will try to load from the url specified by data-source-url - if this is an invalid URL, then this will display as a Network Error.

sections.title: 404 Data
items: If you try and load from an valid URL, but the content is not found, then this will display as a Request failed with status code 404 error.

sections.title: Tabulated Response
items: In this example, the response data is combined with a <formattingTabulation /> component to be formatted into a table.
Any custom template can be provided inside the <template v-slot-"{ response }">...</template> tag to render the response.
